question.title: Unable to create Root Module: config
question.body:
I am working on a small project with gradle & java in which I want to use linting to enforce the coding conventions set by my university:

https://github.com/NHL-Stenden-Emmen/coding-conventions but when I try to use it with my checkstyle.xml the gradle build fails.
I cant seem to find the issue and this is locally, I am planning to build a github actions pipeline for this project which will include the external analysis tool sonarcloud

similar to other questions posted on stackoverflow my build.gradle.kts already refers to the root from where it should have no problem going to the config/checkstyle.xml as is shown under the "checkstyle" where the location is defined

here's my build.gradle.kts

plugins {
    id("java")
    checkstyle
}

group = "org.example"
version = "1.0-SNAPSHOT"

repositories {
    mavenCentral()
}

checkstyle {
    toolVersion = "10.3"
    configFile = file("${rootDir}/config/checkstyle.xml")
}

tasks.withType<Checkstyle>().configureEach {
    reports {
        xml.required.set(true)
        html.required.set(true)
    }
}

dependencies {
    testImplementation(platform("org.junit:junit-bom:5.10.0"))
    testImplementation("org.junit.jupiter:junit-jupiter")
}

tasks.test {
    useJUnitPlatform()
}

along with the error:

C:\Users\Bram\Desktop\JabberpointBramKimmy>gradlew checkstyleMain checkstyleTest
> Task :checkstyleMain FAILED

FAILURE: Build failed with an exception.

* What went wrong:
Execution failed for task ':checkstyleMain'.
> A failure occurred while executing org.gradle.api.plugins.quality.internal.CheckstyleAction
   > An unexpected error occurred configuring and executing Checkstyle.
      > Unable to create Root Module: config {C:\Users\Bram\Desktop\JabberpointBramKimmy\config\checkstyle.xml}, classpath {null}.
